text:
Hi, this is Claire Gribbin,
Worldwide Head of the Small

and Medium Business Customer
Segment for Amazon Web Services.

Small businesses can unlock
benefits of cloud.

Cloud computing offers small
businesses scalability,

cost-efficiency,
and accessibility to advanced
technologies.

If you want to go deeper on understand
what the cloud is and why, you

can check out the previous
video series.

However, migrating to the cloud
requires careful planning

and execution, which can be assisted
through AWS partners.

They can help you understand
cloud computing concepts,

assess migration readiness,
and execute a successful
migration strategy.

Before migrating to the cloud,
it's crucial to assess your
organization's readiness.

AWS Partners in the migration
services category accelerate

small businesses cloud adoption
journey by providing business

expertise, infrastructure,
and application migration

expertise, migration tools,
education, and ongoing support

to customers in the form of professional,
and managed services.

AWS Partners will take care
of all the tasks needed to prepare

your business to embark on the
journey to the cloud.

They will start by taking
inventory of your existing

systems, including servers,
databases, applications,
and storage.

They will also identify
the workloads that are the best

candidates for migration,
considering factors like performance,

security, and compliance
needs.
Next, comes data assessment.

Developing a data strategy
is essential for a smooth
cloud migration.

Partners will determine
what data needs to be migrated,

and what are the associated
privacy and regulatory
requirements.

It's also important to evaluate
your organization's
cloud skills and resources.

What is the focus of your in-house
cloud expertise?

Partners can provide training
to upskill your team and also

assist in the on-going cloud
management needs.

Businesses benefit from working
with a partner, finding that
they save time and money.

Based on the assessment,
AWS partners will develop

a comprehensive migration
strategy and timeline that fits
your business needs.

This includes prioritization
of workloads based on their

criticality and complexity,
and planning for potential

challenges like application
dependencies or data synchronization
issues.

Remember, migration is not an
all-or-nothing proposition.

You can take a phased approach,
starting with less critical

workloads or implementing
a hybrid cloud model.

Ultimately, through partners,
you will get a thorough

assessment that will help you
understand the scope, risks,

and potential benefits of your
cloud migration, enabling

you to make informed decisions
and plan accordingly.

Find the AWS migration
partner that has deep technical

knowledge and proven customer
success today!
